# Kingdom of Days: July 10
#### Originally Published on Ken Rosen's E Street Shuffle blog at https://estreetshuffle.com/index.php/2025/07/10/kingdom-of-days-july-10-2/
#### Published: July 10, 2025
#### Last Updated: July 02, 2025
![19880710_front.jpg](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/19880710_front.jpg)

***New for 2025:** No updates*
**1966:** The Castiles play a brief set at the Surf ‘N’ See Club in Sea Bright, New Jersey.
**1971:** The Bruce Springsteen Band makes its debut, headlining at Brookdale Community College’s 2nd Annual “Nothing’s Festival” in Lincroft, New Jersey. (There wasn’t a first annual festival, and the show is free and unpaid–but a gig’s a gig.)
[Youtube: Bruce Springsteen Band playing "CC Rider-Down The Road Apiece"1971-07-10](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AqnlX8oq-2g)
![](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AqnlX8oq-2g)
[Youtube: Bruce Springsteen Band playing "You Mean So Much To Me" 1971-07-10](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zWURsgK_-4M)
![](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zWURsgK_-4M)
[Youtube: Bruce Springsteen Band playing "Nothing Can Stop Me" 1971-07-10](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r6all5hMCWY)
![](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r6all5hMCWY)
![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/1971-07-10-300x104.jpg?resize=758%2C263)
**1983:** Bruce joins Cats on a Smooth Surface for five songs at The Stone Pony in Asbury Park, including “[Wooly Bully](http://estreetshuffle.com/index.php/2018/03/31/cover-me-woolly-bully/)” and “[Little Latin Lupe Lu](http://estreetshuffle.com/index.php/2019/04/21/cover-me-little-latin-lupe-lu/).”
**1987:** Columbia Records producer, executive, and Bruce Springsteen-signer John Hammond passes away at the age of 76. Here’s Bruce talking about his admiration for Hammond in an early interview.
[Youtube: Springsteen - 1976 Hammond Interview](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C3OJKnbSQb0)
![](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C3OJKnbSQb0)
![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/1987-07-10-300x234.jpg?resize=758%2C591)
**1988:** Bruce and the E Street Band play their second of two Tunnel of Love shows at Bramall Lane in Sheffield.
[https://videopress.com/embed/EZbUAKue?hd=1&amp;cover=1&amp;loop=0&amp;autoPlay=0&amp;permalink=1&amp;muted=0&amp;controls=1&amp;playsinline=0&amp;useAverageColor=0&amp;preloadContent=metadata](https://videopress.com/embed/EZbUAKue?hd=1&amp;cover=1&amp;loop=0&amp;autoPlay=0&amp;permalink=1&amp;muted=0&amp;controls=1&amp;playsinline=0&amp;useAverageColor=0&amp;preloadContent=metadata)
[Youtube: Sheffield 10/07/1988](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=videoseries)
![](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=videoseries)
![](https://estreetshuffle.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/The_Miami_Herald_1988_07_11_9-scaled.jpg)
**1990:** Sixteen years after its original release, *The Wild, The Innocent & The E Street Shuffle* is finally certified platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America.
[Youtube: Sheffield 10/07/1988](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=videoseries)
![](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=videoseries)
**1992:** Night Three of five at Wembley Arena on World Tour 1992 features an acoustic “[Dancing in the Dark](https://estreetshuffle.com/index.php/2021/12/25/roll-of-the-dice-dancing-in-the-dark/).”
[Youtube: Bruce Springsteen - Dancing In The Dark (live 1992)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a-SPT1ZR_Eo)
![](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a-SPT1ZR_Eo)
[Youtube: Bruce Springsteen - WITH EVERY WISH](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EvQUeL841A0)
![](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EvQUeL841A0)
**2018:** *Springsteen on Broadway* resumes its theatrical run at the Walter Kerr Theater in New York City after a nine-day break. Patti is absent tonight, so Bruce drops their duets and instead substitutes “[Long Time Comin’](https://estreetshuffle.com/index.php/2022/06/19/roll-of-the-dice-long-time-comin/)” in their place. To make up for playing one fewer song than usual, Bruce adds an encore of sorts: “This Hard Land.”
> [View this post on Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/BlE1KCGlMdN/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)

**2019:** Bruce breaks news when he calls in to E Street Radio: a new film is on the way, a concert film based on *Western Stars,* directed by Thom Zimny. When it’s released later in the year, Bruce will take a co-director credit.
> Just got off a 10-minute call with [@Springsteen](https://twitter.com/springsteen?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw). "I wanted to see if the number really worked," he told E Street Radio hosts Dave Marsh and Jim Rotolo. [pic.twitter.com/4hcA6201Ej](https://t.co/4hcA6201Ej)
>
> — SiriusXM (@SIRIUSXM) [July 10, 2019](https://twitter.com/SIRIUSXM/status/1148976398666739718?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
**2021:** *Springsteen on Broadway* continues its limited return engagement at the St. James Theater in New York City.
